summary: Users passing nameless/anonymous functions to infer workflow names receive unhelpful error messages. The SDK should validate function names at runtime and provide better error messages when functions aren't exported or named properly.
userImpact: Users receive cryptic error messages when passing nameless functions or unexported workflows, making debugging difficult.
rootCause: SDK lacks runtime validation for function names and doesn't wrap underlying ReferenceError with contextual information.
proposedFix: Add validation to check that user-provided functions have names at registration time and wrap ReferenceError with more informative messaging.
resolutionDetails: Issue closed - appears to have been addressed in subsequent SDK updates
keyQuote: As for nameless function, I think the client should easily be able to check that at runtime. We could also wrap the ReferenceError in a more informative error.
